Column Comment.0: SUPPORT FACILITY SUBTYPE: The type of support facility that is described by thisrow of data. These values are managed by check constraint, and may only be thename of a valid sub type of support facility.
Column Comment.1: SUPPORT FACILITY IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the support facility. A supportfacility provides operational support for activities. These facilities may include roads,transmission towers, airstrips, vessels, docks and so on. Sub tyes are used tomaintain integration with the rest of the model.
Column Comment.2: DESCRIPTION OBSERVATION NUMBER: a number identifying the description.
Column Comment.3: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.4: COST: The cost of a descriptive item for the support facility. Note that costs ingeneral should go in the FIN module - this module is used for descriptive purposes,not for capturing the cost of maintenance events.
Column Comment.7: CURRENCY CONVERSION RATE: the rate applied to convert the currency from itsoriginal monetary UOM to the stored UOM. This value is valid for this row in this tableonly. When this value is multiplied by the STORED currency value, the original valueof the transaction in the original currency is obtained.
Column Comment.8: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.9: DESCRIPTION: short textual description of the support facility. This column is notvalidated against a reference table.
Column Comment.10: SUPPORT FACILITY DESCRIPTION TYPE: the type of description for a supportfacility, such as color, construction material etc.
Column Comment.11: VALUE: A numeric value assigned to the description, used when numbers arerequired.
Column Comment.12: VALUE CODE: descriptive code associated with a support facility in the case wherethe description is codified.
Column Comment.15: EFFECTIVE DATE: the date on which this row of data first came into effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.16: EXPIRY DATE: the date on which this row of data is no longer in effect from abusiness perspective.
Column Comment.17: MAXIMUM VALUE: the maximum value associated with this type of description.
Column Comment.20: MINIMUM VALUE: The minumum value associated with this type of description.
Column Comment.23: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.24: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.25: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.27: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.29: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.32: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
